solution_line_template: She needs {cups_strawberries_per_quart} cups of strawberries per quart of ice cream and the strawberries are sold in {strawberry_package_size} cup packages. So {cups_strawberries_per_quart}/{strawberry_package_size} = <<{cups_strawberries_per_quart}/{strawberry_package_size}={num_strawberry_packages}>>{num_strawberry_packages} packages of strawberries

The strawberries cost ${cost_strawberry_package} per package and she needs {num_strawberry_packages} so {cost_strawberry_package}*{num_strawberry_packages}=$<<{cost_strawberry_package}*{num_strawberry_packages}={total_cost_strawberries}>>{total_cost_strawberries}

She needs {cups_raspberries_per_quart} cups of raspberries per quart of ice cream and the raspberries are sold in {raspberry_package_size} cup packages. So {cups_raspberries_per_quart}/{raspberry_package_size} = <<{cups_raspberries_per_quart}/{raspberry_package_size}={num_raspberry_packages}>>{num_raspberry_packages} packages of raspberries

The raspberries cost ${cost_raspberry_package} per package and she needs {num_raspberry_packages} so {cost_raspberry_package}*{num_raspberry_packages} = $<<{cost_raspberry_package}*{num_raspberry_packages}={total_cost_raspberries}>>{total_cost_raspberries}

Every quart needs {cups_cream_per_quart} cups of heavy cream and she's making {num_quarts_to_make} quarts so {cups_cream_per_quart}*{num_quarts_to_make} = <<{cups_cream_per_quart}*{num_quarts_to_make}={total_cups_cream_needed}>>{total_cups_cream_needed} quarts

She will spend ${total_cost_strawberries} on strawberries, ${total_cost_raspberries} on raspberries and ${cost_heavy_cream_container} on heavy cream bringing the total to {total_cost_strawberries}+{total_cost_raspberries}+{cost_heavy_cream_container} = $<<{total_cost_strawberries}+{total_cost_raspberries}+{cost_heavy_cream_container}={total_cost}>>{total_cost}
